sources.title: The Barbarian And The Geisha (1958) John Wayne
sources.description: In 1856, diplomat Townsend Harris takes over the newly established American consulate in Japan and receives unexpected help from a geisha in his difficulties with the xenophobic population. Â  An operetta-like picture-book drama with exotic decor, inadequate storytelling, and John Wayne in a misguided role.

metadata.Plot: Townsend Harris is sent by President Pierce to Japan to serve as the first U.S. Consul-General to that country. Harris discovers enormous hostility to foreigners, as well as the love of a young geisha.
metadata.Writer: Charles Grayson, Ellis St. Joseph, Nigel Balchin
metadata.Actors: John Wayne, Eiko Ando, Sam Jaffe
